job_tasks.phrase: ensuring the quality and reliability of our products
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes a core software engineering responsibility related to the overall quality and stability of the software product, fitting under the broader umbrella of software development and integration.

job_tasks.phrase: You develop and execute test plans
job_tasks.justification: Developing and executing test plans is a fundamental part of the software development lifecycle, ensuring that the software functions as intended.
Identifying and reporting defects is a key task in software quality assurance, directly contributing to the software development process by highlighting areas for improvement.

job_tasks.phrase: collaborate with our development team to resolve issues
job_tasks.justification: Collaboration with the development team to resolve issues is a standard software engineering practice aimed at improving the product.

job_tasks.phrase: create and implement comprehensive test plans
job_tasks.justification: This directly relates to the planning and execution of quality assurance activities within the software development lifecycle.
Performing tests, whether manual or automated, is a core activity in ensuring software quality and is part of the broader software development and integration process.
Reporting test findings is essential for communicating the quality status of the software and informing the development team, a key part of the software development process.

job_tasks.phrase: Develop, implement, and maintain test plans and test cases
job_tasks.justification: This is a direct description of core software quality assurance tasks that are integral to the software development lifecycle.

job_tasks.phrase: Execute manual and automated tests to identify software defects
job_tasks.justification: This describes the practical application of testing methodologies to find flaws in software, a key component of software development.

job_tasks.phrase: Collaborate with the development team to resolve identified issues
job_tasks.justification: This highlights the collaborative nature of software development, where QA works with developers to fix problems.

job_tasks.phrase: Perform regression testing to ensure product stability
job_tasks.justification: Regression testing is a crucial activity in software development to ensure that new changes do not negatively impact existing functionality.

job_tasks.phrase: Document and report test results, and provide feedback for continuous improvement
job_tasks.justification: Documenting and reporting results, along with providing feedback, are essential for the iterative improvement of software products.

job_tasks.phrase: Participate in code reviews and provide input on quality assurance standards and processes
job_tasks.justification: Participating in code reviews and contributing to QA standards are direct contributions to the software development and integration process, ensuring code quality.

job_tasks.phrase: Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies in software testing
job_tasks.justification: While focused on testing, staying updated with trends is a professional development aspect within the broader software engineering domain.

soft_skills.justification: This phrase directly refers to a key soft skill related to identifying and resolving issues, which is crucial in a QA role.
This explicitly mentions collaboration, a core aspect of communication and teamwork in a professional setting.

soft_skills.phrase: Collaborate with the development team to resolve identified issues
soft_skills.justification: This highlights the need for teamwork and communication to address software defects.
Providing feedback is a form of communication aimed at improving processes and outcomes.

soft_skills.phrase: Participate in code reviews and provide input on quality assurance standards and processes
soft_skills.justification: Participating in reviews and providing input requires communication and collaboration with peers and the development team.

profile.rationale: The job advertisement focuses exclusively on Quality Assurance (QA) tasks, such as developing and executing test plans, identifying bugs, performing regression testing, and collaborating with developers to resolve issues. There is no mention of developing, fine-tuning, or integrating AI/ML models or generative AI specific tasks. All identified tasks fall under Macro-Category A (Core Software Engineering), specifically within Software Development & Integration (1.A.1). Therefore, the role is classified as a 'Software Engineer'.

confidence.reasoning: The job advertisement is very clear and specific about the responsibilities, which are entirely focused on traditional software quality assurance. There is no ambiguity or mention of AI/ML, making the classification straightforward.
